author: Special Correspondent
text:
The High Court on Tuesday took cognizance in the case of two babies abandoned by parents for suffering from medical deformities here and later admitted to the G.B. Pant hospital.

Taking suo motu cognizance on the basis of media reports, Justice Muzaffar Hussain Attar directed the hospital authorities to take “medical care of the babies” and “not to hand them over to any unregistered organisations”.

Both the cases were reported in the last one month. While one baby, suffering from Down’s syndrome, was left outside the hospital itself, another month-old-baby boy was abandoned at a shrine in the old city.

“The authorities were finding it difficult to keep the babies in the hospital for long. We are providing necessary healthcare, but we can’t keep them here forever,” said Medical Superintendent Dr. Shafaqat Khan.

After media reports caught the attention of the general public, a number of individuals and groups have approached the hospital authorities seeking adoption of the infants.
title: Take medical care of abandoned babies: Court tells Srinagar hospital
